--- Eugene Kuleshov <eu@m...> wrote:
>   Anyway, it does work fine if you s=
et a breakpoint in the
> code or exception breakpoint, then code can be rep=
laced.
> However I have hard time to rerun test cases created by my
> suite=
 method. You are right that with "keep junit running"
> option in debug mod=
e "Run" action does not fail, but it
> does not execute the test either. I'=
ve added tracing to the
> test method and it is just not being called. I st=
ill wonder
> what am I doing wrong here?
> 
>   I am using Eclipse 3.2M1...=


I think you're right.  For me, it works (and runs the code!) when 
rerunn=
ing individual test method instances /that were found using 
the standard T=
estSuite(TestCase) constructor/.  But for dynamically 
generated test cases=
, it doesn't rerun them.  Looks like an Eclipse 
bug to me.



(For lurkers=
:  The Eclipse "Keep JUnit running after a test run when 
debugging" option=
 is on the run configuration screen.  Menu: "Run -> 
Run..."; not "Windows =
-> Preferences -> ...")
